discussion.author: lgoettgens
discussion.text: I think this package's name contradicts the first naming rule "1. Avoid jargon. In particular, avoid acronyms unless there is minimal possibility of confusion.". It would be great if you could change the name to something more descriptive. Unfortunately, I could not find in your docs what "AME" is an abbreviation for, and so I am not able to give some suggestions.
I understand the problems, and I will change the name of the package. But I don't know what I should do? Close this pull-request and make a new one? It seems I cannot close this pull-request.

discussion.author: lgoettgens
discussion.text:
Just rename your package and re-trigger registration. This will the create a new PR to the registry.
This PR can just be abandoned. Due to our comments, it will no longer be merged automatically. Instead, CI will close it in about a month.

discussion.author: lgoettgens
discussion.text: Maybe something like "AtomicMassEvaluation" (if that's the long form of the abbreviation. I just found that in one of the links in your README).
